channel.title: Free Analyst Notes
channel.description: Recent content on Free Analyst Notes

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: Creating a New Theme
item.description: Introduction This tutorial will show you how to create a simple theme in Hugo. I assume that you are familiar with HTML, the bash command line, and that you are comfortable using Markdown to format content. I'll explain how Hugo uses templates and how you can organize your templates to create a theme. I won't cover using CSS to style your theme. We'll start with creating a new site with a very basic template.

item.title: About Hugo
item.description: Hugo is the world’s fastest framework for building websites. It is written in Go. It makes use of a variety of open source projects including: https://github.com/russross/blackfriday https://github.com/alecthomas/chroma https://github.com/muesli/smartcrop https://github.com/spf13/cobra https://github.com/spf13/viper Learn more and contribute on GitHub.

item.title: (Hu)go Template Primer
item.description: Hugo uses the excellent Go html/template library for its template engine. It is an extremely lightweight engine that provides a very small amount of logic. In our experience that it is just the right amount of logic to be able to create a good static website. If you have used other template systems from different languages or frameworks you will find a lot of similarities in Go templates. This document is a brief primer on using Go templates.

item.title: Getting Started with Hugo
item.description: Step 1. Install Hugo Go to Hugo releases and download the appropriate version for your OS and architecture. Save it somewhere specific as we will be using it in the next step. More complete instructions are available at Install Hugo Step 2. Build the Docs Hugo has its own example site which happens to also be the documentation site you are reading right now. Follow the following steps: Clone the Hugo repository Go into the repo Run hugo in server mode and build the docs Open your browser to http://localhost:1313 Corresponding pseudo commands:

item.title: Migrate to Hugo from Jekyll
item.description: Move static content to static Jekyll has a rule that any directory not starting with _ will be copied as-is to the _site output. Hugo keeps all static content under static. You should therefore move it all there. With Jekyll, something that looked like ▾ <root>/ ▾ images/ logo.png should become ▾ <root>/ ▾ static/ ▾ images/ logo.png Additionally, you'll want any files that should reside at the root (such as CNAME) to be moved to static.

item.title: CFA Level 1 - Economics
item.description: Supply and Demand Determinants of Demand Determinants of Supply Price Elasticity Price Elasticity of Demand Factors that influence Elasticity of Demand Cross Elasticity of Demand Income Elasticity of Demand Price Elasticity of Supply Factors that influence Elasticity of Supply Macro Economy Gross Domestic Product (GDP) Causes of inflation Tax incidence Opportunity Cost Economic Profit Implicit Costs (opportunity costs): Economic Efficiency Short-Run Output Average Total Cost (ATC) is U-shaped Long-Run Output Factors that contribute to output (GDP) Perfect Competition Shutdown Price Firm’s Supply Curve Monopoly Labor Unions Supply and Demand Determinants of Demand Income

item.title: Cfa Level 1 Equities
item.description: Equities Types of Orders Financing Underwriting Markets Short Selling Indexes/Indices Constructing an Index Price-Weighted Index Market-Weighted Index Efficient Market Hypothesis Abnormal rate of return Tests for Market Efficiency Tests for independence Return prediction studies Strong-form Efficiency Market Anamolies (public information - tests for Semi-strong EMH) Reasons Why Markets Should be Efficient EMH Conclusions Role of Portfolio Managers (in a perfectly efficient market) Exchange Traded Funds (ETFs) Issuing ETFs Equities Types of Orders Market Orders - Buy or sell orders that are executed at the current price (guarantees execution, but not price) Limit Orders - Buy or sell orders when the stock price passes a desirable limit (guarantees price or better, but not execution) Limit Buy - purchase a stock if and when it can be bout at-or-below a certain price Limit Sell - sell a stock if and when it rises above a certain price Note: A collection of limit orders is called the limit order book.

item.title: CFA Level 1: Alternative Investments
item.description: Futures and Forward Contracts Forward Contract Terminating a forward contract Delivery Swaps Futures Contract Eurodollar Deposit Euribor Deposit LIBOR Euribor Time Deposit Forward Rate Agreement (FRA) “NxM” Notation T-Bill Futures Contract Eurodollar Futures Currency Forward Contract Interest Rate Options Swaps Swaps Ways to Terminate a Swap Currency Swap Interest Rate Swap Commodity Futures Returns Bond Futures and Forwards Futures and Forward Contracts Forward Contract A customized, unregulated private contract between parties to exchange some asset at a future date and guaranteed price.
